intro: Hieracium × subgermanicum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a hybrid species within the genus Hieracium, which belongs to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy stems, often growing in meadows and disturbed soils. The plant is perennial and can form dense colonies, making it an invasive species in some regions. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This species is known for its adaptability and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
